title: Introduction to Proxy Pattern
content: What is the Proxy Pattern in JavaScript and how does it differ from directly interacting with an object?

title: Basic Proxy Usage
content: You have an object `person = { name: 'John', age: 30 }`. Create a proxy that logs whenever any property is accessed.

title: Handler Methods
content: Which two handler methods are most commonly used in JavaScript Proxies?

title: Validation with Proxies
content: How can the Proxy pattern help with data validation? Give an example.

title: Logging Changes
content: Write a proxy that prevents setting `age` to a non-numeric value and logs attempts with an error message.

title: Proxy and Non-Existent Properties
content: When trying to access a property that does not exist, how can a Proxy handler respond?
options: Any of the above, depending on the handler logic

title: Reflect with Proxies
content: What is the role of the `Reflect` object when working with Proxies, and why is it preferred over direct property access?

title: Refactoring Proxy with Reflect
content: Rewrite this Proxy handler to use `Reflect.get` and `Reflect.set` instead of direct object manipulation.

title: Proxy Use Cases
content: Which of the following are valid use cases for the Proxy pattern?

title: Tradeoffs of Proxy
content: What are the performance tradeoffs of using Proxy objects in large applications?
